UBS Family Office Clients Eye Hedge Fund Bets Amid Volatility
content: UBS Group AG’s family office clients are leaning into hedge fund allocations as they focus on more active strategies to help navigate the shifting macroeconomic landscape.

title: Nordea Questions Norway’s Data on Faltering Home Construction
content: Norway’s official data showing sluggish housing construction may skew the real picture, according to analysts with Nordea Bank Abp, who cited competing evidence of a rise in housing starts.

title: Landlord GPE Anticipates Rent Surge on Supply Shortage
content: Landlord Great Portland Estates Plc expects London office rents to surge next year as a shortage of new development collides with robust demand for the best new space.

title: UK Inflation Surge Prompts Traders to Rein In Bets on BOE Cuts
content: UK inflation jumped more than forecast to its highest rate in over a year as households were hit by a raft of price increases, prompting investors to pare bets on rate cuts from the Bank of England.

title: Critical Minerals at Higher Risk of Painful Disruption, Says IEA
content: Critical minerals are at increasing risk of “painful disruption” due to their higher concentration in a handful of countries and the spread of export restrictions, according to a report from the International Energy Agency.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Inflation Rises 3.5% in April, Higher Than Expected
Chandra Asri Is Said to Seek $1 Billion Valuation for Unit’s IPO
content: Chandra Asri Pacific’s infrastructure investment unit is seeking a valuation of at least $1 billion in its planned initial public offering in Indonesia, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Oil Climbs on Report That Israel Is Preparing to Strike Iran
content: Oil jumped following a CNN report that new US intelligence suggests Israel is preparing for a potential strike on Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: Global Investment, Crypto and AI Top Agenda at Qatar Economic Forum
Oil Jumps on Report of Israel Plans to Strike Iran
content: Oil climbed following a CNN report that new US intelligence suggests Israel is preparing for a potential strike on Iranian nuclear facilities. Oil has been volatile since last week on mixed headlines about the fate of Iran-US nuclear talks. Bloomberg’s Stephen Stapczynski reports.

title: Indonesian State-Miner Antam Seeks $500 Million Syndicated Loan
content: Indonesian miner Aneka Tambang Tbk, better known as Antam, is seeking a $500 million loan, according to people familiar with the matter, in what would be the country’s first syndicated dollar borrowing from a state-owned enterprise this year.

title: Oil Rises on Israel-Iran Report, Dollar Weakens: Markets Wrap
content: Oil rose to the highest level in a week and the dollar declined after CNN reported that new US intelligence suggested Israel is preparing for a potential strike on Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: David Webb Warns About CATL’s Low Free Float in Hong Kong
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd.’s recent Hong Kong stock offering, the world’s largest listing this year, prompted a local activist investor to warn about the concentration of its shareholdings.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 5/21/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hong Kong Dollar Nears Weak End of Band on Carry-Trade Selling
content: The Hong Kong dollar edged closer to the weak end of its trading range as sliding local interest rates encouraged traders to increase their borrowing of the currency to fund carry trades.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 05/21/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Morgan Stanley Strategists Say Buy America Except the Dollar
content: Morgan Stanley has raised its call on US stocks and Treasuries on expectations that a slew of future interest-rate cuts by the Federal Reserve will support bonds and boost company earnings.

title: Dollar Extends Slide With G-7 Meeting, Budget Deficit in Focus
content: A gauge of the dollar fell to a two-week low as traders focused on the Group-of-7 meeting for any signs that the Trump administration is seeking a weaker US dollar.

title: Hengrui Pharma Prices at Top End for $1.3 Billion Hong Kong Listing
content: Jiangsu Hengrui Pharmaceuticals Co. priced its Hong Kong stock offering at the top of the marketed range to raise HK$9.9 billion ($1.3 billion).

title: Covid Testing Demand Surges as Cases Spike Across Asia
content: Demand for Covid tests is increasing in Hong Kong as cases surge in recent weeks, according to the top executive of diagnostic kit-maker Phase Scientific International Ltd.

title: Macho-Pessimists Say Inflation’ll Be Back
content: Tariffs will bring it with an unblinking certitude; the only question is when.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 05/21/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Sydney with Haidi Stroud-Watts and Paul Allen, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Buyers Recoil From Japanese Bonds in Warning on BOJ Balance-Sheet Cuts
content: Japan’s sovereign debt market is flashing a warning to the central bank that dialing back its bond purchases needs to be done with great care.

title: BYD’s Hong Kong Shares Hit Record Premium Over Onshore Stock
content: BYD Co.’s shares rose to a record high in Hong Kong, expanding their premium over those trading on the mainland to the highest level ever.

title: South Africa Arbiter Proposes More Pay to Avoid Logistics Strike
content: A third-party arbiter proposed a higher wage offer to South Africa’s state-owned ports and rail company and its unions in a bid to stave off a potential strike by thousands of logistics workers.

title: Chinese Authorities Question Metals Bosses in Smuggling Probe
content: Chinese authorities have questioned the heads of some of the country’s leading metals merchants and producers as part of an intensifying effort to crack down on critical-minerals smuggling, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: EU Sanctions Ships That Moved LNG From Russia’s Yamal Plant
content: The European Union imposed sanctions on three vessels that helped move gas cargoes from Russia’s Yamal LNG project, further squeezing Moscow’s energy revenues.

title: Global LNG Suppliers Wager That China’s Demand Slump Is Fleeting
content: Global gas giants are betting the current lull in Chinese demand is temporary, and that the country will underpin their multibillion-dollar investments for years to come.

title: Fed's Daly, Hammack on Outlook for US Economy
content: San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly and Cleveland Fed President Beth Hammack talk about their outlook for the US economy and adopting a wait-and-see approach to policy, in an event moderated by Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic. They all spoke at the Atlanta Fed's "Financial Intermediation in Transition" conference. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Japan’s Farm Minister Quits Over Rice Gaffe in Blow to Ishiba
content: Japan’s farm minister quit Wednesday after saying he’s never needed to buy rice, a comment that fueled criticism of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s minority government and its handling of rising food prices ahead of an election.

title: Pakistan Names First Field Marshal in 60 Years After India Clash
content: Pakistan promoted its army chief to field marshal for the first time in over sixty years, citing the country’s ‘success’ in this month’s military confrontation with India.

title: French Prosecutors Claim Najib Had Role in 2002 Submarine Deal Bribes
content: Allegations against former Malaysian prime minister are in 2024 court document. Prosecutors haven’t recommended that Najib stands trial.

title: Chinese Authorities Question Metals Bosses in Smuggling Probe
content: Chinese authorities have questioned the heads of some of the country’s leading metals merchants and producers as part of an intensifying effort to crack down on critical-minerals smuggling, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Trump’s Genocide Claim Rakes Up South Africa’s Apartheid Past
content: The US president’s offer of refugee status for Afrikaners comes as his administration slashes spending that was helping Black South Africans.

title: Historic Fall in UK Migration Can’t Come Fast Enough for Starmer
content: Figures due on Thursday are likely to show Keir Starmer presiding over the biggest ever drop in net migration to the UK. For the prime minister, however, the hard part will be getting any credit from voters.

title: EU Sanctions Ships That Moved LNG From Russia’s Yamal Plant
content: The European Union imposed sanctions on three vessels that helped move gas cargoes from Russia’s Yamal LNG project, further squeezing Moscow’s energy revenues.

title: US Deports Migrants to War-Torn South Sudan, Court Records Say
content: A federal judge in Boston has ordered the Trump administration to “maintain custody” of a group of migrant men who may have been deported to South Sudan on Tuesday.

title: G-7 Finance Ministers Aim to Avoid Public Spats With US Despite Trade Turmoil
content: Finance ministers who’ve gathered in Canada for a Group of Seven meeting this week face a difficult task — trying to find common ground on trade issues while avoiding public conflict with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.

title: China Threatens Enforcers of US’s Huawei Curbs With Legal Action
content: China said it could take legal action against anyone enforcing US restrictions on using Huawei Technologies Co.’s AI chips, escalating a dispute that’s upset a tentative truce on tariffs.

title: Trump Loses Patience With SALT Demand as Tax Bill Faces Snag
content: President Donald Trump is growing frustrated with demands to significantly boost the cap on the state and local tax deduction, according to a senior administration official, signaling a deadlock as Republicans aim to quickly pass a giant tax-cut bill.

title: FAA Cuts Newark Flights After Air Traffic Control Issues
content: US aviation safety regulators will allow fewer flights at Newark airport after technology outages and a staffing crunch fueled a surge in delays and cancellations in recent weeks.

title: US, Philippine Coast Guards Join Navy Drills Amid China Tensions
content: The US and the Philippines held a new round of joint sails within Manila’s exclusive economic zone, with their coast guards participating for the first time, amid continuing tensions in the disputed South China Sea.

title: Chicago Suburb Plans to Seize Pope Leo’s Childhood Home
content: A Chicago-area town plans to seize control of Pope Leo XIV’s childhood home, just days after the current owner put the property up for auction.

title: Reeves to Meet Bessent as Questions Linger Over UK-US Deal
content: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will hold talks with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent this week, as the two countries continue to finalize the details of an agreement to cut tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump’s administration.

title: Bloody Murders in Quiet Neighborhood Shatter Mexico City’s Calm
content: In the vast swaths of Mexico controlled by drug cartels, public executions and mass graves have long been the norm. Mexico City has largely been a haven from the goriest headlines.

title: Trump Says Golden Dome Will Be Operational in Three Years
content: President Donald Trump vowed that a “Golden Dome” missile-defense shield would be “fully operational” by the end of his term, and offer the US protection from an array of threats — even though some of the technology remains unproven.

title: Mexico City Mayor’s Aides Shot Dead by Attackers on Motorbikes
content: Two senior aides to Mexico City Mayor Clara Brugada were shot dead Tuesday in the highest-profile political violence to strike the Latin American metropolis since cartel gunmen ambushed the capital’s former police chief five years ago.

title: South Africa’s Budget Gets Third Reboot With Credibility on Line
content: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana’s third attempt to deliver a budget represents his sternest test yet.

title: US Clears Way for Tariffs on $13 Billion of Solar Imports
content: US duties on solar equipment from four Southeast Asian countries are set to take effect following a government agency’s conclusion the imports harm domestic manufacturers.

title: UK Sanctions British Accountant for Alleged Russia Ship Deals
content: The UK sanctioned an English accountant for allegedly helping Russia expand the fleet of tankers it uses to covertly ship crude around the globe.

title: ‘Original Sin’ Lays Out How Biden’s Decline Was Hidden by Family, Staff
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green looks at the revelations in a new book about how former President Joe Biden’s family and staff hid his decline while in office. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Sanctions Risk Pushing Russia Away From Talks, Rubio Says
content: President Donald Trump thinks Russia will likely walk away from Ukraine peace talks if the US threatens more sanctions, according to his top diplomat, supporting the White House’s decision not to pressure Moscow despite its resistance to a ceasefire.

title: Trump Says Golden Dome System Will Be Operational in Three Years
content: President Donald Trump vowed that a “Golden Dome” missile-defense shield should be “fully operational” by the end of his term, saying it would be able to protect the US from threats including ballistic missiles, hypersonics and advanced cruise missiles.

title: Venezuela Frees American as Chevron Waiver Is Set to Be Extended
content: Venezuela released an American citizen on the same day the US was set to give Chevron Corp. another 60-day waiver to operate in the country, part of a push by President Nicolas Maduro’s government and some voices in the Trump administration to improve ties.

title: Trump Promised Record Deportations. How’s That Going?
content: President Donald Trump has vowed to carry out the largest deportation campaign in US history, a promise that mirrors one he made but failed to fulfill during his first term. This time, Trump has shown greater determination.

title: Dutch Government Needs to Spend Up to €19 Billion More to Meet NATO Target
content: The Netherlands estimates it will need to boost defense spending by as much as €19 billion ($21.4 billion) a year to meet the expected new target for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: Hegseth Starts Fresh Probe Into ‘Disastrous’ Afghanistan Pullout
content: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced a new probe into the 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal, vowing accountability for what he called the Biden administration’s “disastrous and embarrassing” handling of the events that led to the deaths of 13 US troops.

title: European Officials Step Up Pressure on Israel Over Gaza War
content: European and UK officials ratcheted up pressure on Israel over its latest offensive in Gaza, expanding the international outcry over the humanitarian crisis caused by the conflict.

title: EU Removes All Remaining Economic Sanctions Against Syria
content: The European Union has lifted all remaining economic sanctions against Syria, the bloc’s top diplomat Kaja Kallas told reporters after foreign ministers gathered in Brussels on Tuesday.

title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe 05/21/2025
content:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

title: Musk and Afrikaners Cloud the Trump-Ramaphosa Meeting Agenda
content: President Donald Trump's offer of refugee status to White Afrikaners has the potential to become a flashpoint as South African President Cyril Ramaphosa meets Trump in Washington on Wednesday. Also on the agenda: Ramaphosa's government plans to offer Elon Musk a workaround of local Black-ownership laws for his Starlink internet service to operate in the country, aiming to ease tensions with both the billionaire and Trump. Bloomberg's Anthony Sguazzin reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Westpac Plans to Eliminate More Than 1,500 Jobs, AFR Reports
content: Westpac Banking Corp. is planning to cut more than 1,500 jobs in the bank’s biggest redundancy in a decade as it strives to meet ambitious cost reduction targets, the Australian Financial Review reported, citing unidentified people.

title: New Fortress Energy Disqualified From Puerto Rico Power Auction
content: New Fortress Energy has been disqualified from an auction held by the Puerto Rican government to secure temporary power generation, the latest setback for billionaire Wes Edens’ troubled company.

title: Real Problem Is Medicaid Cuts: Rep. Pallone on Tax Bill
content: Rep. Frank Pallone (D) New Jersey discusses the tax bill and states the focus on SALT is "misplaced." He goes on to talk about how the tax cuts in the proposed legislation will benefit large corporations with cuts to Medicaid paying for them, what he can still do to prevent cuts to Medicaid, and shares his thoughts on the DOJ charging New Jersey Representative LaMonica McIver with assault after a confrontation outside an ICE detention facility. Rep. Pallone speaks with Kailey Leinz and Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Kori Schake on Trump Retreats From Ukraine Peace Talks
content: Kori Schake, Senior Fellow & Director of Foreign and Defense Policy Studies at the American Enterprise Institute, shares her thoughts on talks between President Trump & President Putin and states President Putin is setting the cadence of Ukraine peace talks. She also discusses  how additional sanctions will not apply added pressure on Russia, what needs to happen to help support Ukraine, and her thoughts on Trump's announcement of a 'golden dome' missile shield. title: Apple Prepares to Open AI Models to Third-Party App Developers
content: Good morning. Apple is said to open AI models to third-party developers. Humans can’t keep up with developments in artificial intelligence. And Art Basel announces a fifth location. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: Take-Two, QXO Launch $2 Billion Wave of Share Sales After Hours
content: A trio of companies kicked off a surge of large share sales after the close of US trading on Tuesday, in deals that could raise at least $2 billion in aggregate.

title: ICYMI: Jennifer Grancio on Volatility and Trade War
content: Source: Bloomberg, 9:02

title: Marks & Spencer Says Cyberattack to Cost £300 Million
content: Marks & Spencer Group Plc is facing a £300 million ($403 million) hit to operating profit this fiscal year from a cyberattack that’s still disrupting the company’s sales and operations.

title: Nvidia CEO Urges US to Ease AI Curbs After ‘Failure’ With China
content: Nvidia Corp. chief Jensen Huang blasted the “failure” of US restrictions intended to help contain China’s technological ascent, calling on the White House to lower barriers to AI chip sales before American firms cede that market to up-and-coming rivals such as Huawei Technologies Co.

title: UAE Releases Falcon Arabic AI Model To Outcompete Mideast Rivals
content: A research arm of the Abu Dhabi government has released a powerful new Arabic-language artificial intelligence model in a bid to preserve its technological lead over rivals in the Middle East.

title: Accenture to Promote 50,000 Staff After Six-Month Delay
content: Accenture Plc will promote almost 50,000 people worldwide in June as the company tries to boost morale after a six-month delay to weather a slump in demand for consulting services.

title: Theta Capital Secures $175 Million for Crypto Fund Investments
content: Crypto investment firm Theta Capital Management closed a raise of more than $175 million for a fund-of-funds that will back institutional investors in early-stage blockchain startups.

title: Swedish Startup Einride Shuffles Management Ahead of IPO Push
content: Einride AB is shaking up its top management as the Swedish driverless truck startup lays the groundwork for a possible initial public offering.

title: SoftBank Taps Mizuho, SMBC, JPMorgan to Lead $15 Billion Loan
content: SoftBank Group Corp.’s investments in AI will be financed through a loan in which Mizuho Bank Ltd., Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. and JPMorgan Chase & Co. serve as lead underwriters — a sign of the Japanese tech investor’s ability to secure financing for its outsized ambitions.

title: China AI Rally Laggard Baidu Faces Low Bar for Earnings Boost
content: The current earnings season has largely been a letdown for China’s big tech stocks, lowering the hurdle for Baidu Inc. to impress investors seeking a fresh angle on the artificial intelligence theme.

title: Inside the First Stargate AI Data Center
content: OpenAI, Oracle and SoftBank hope that the site in Texas is the first of many across the US.

title: China Threatens Enforcers of US’s Huawei Curbs With Legal Action
content: China said it could take legal action against anyone enforcing US restrictions on using Huawei Technologies Co.’s AI chips, escalating a dispute that’s upset a tentative truce on tariffs.

title: ‘Fortnite’ Returns to Apple App Store After Four-Year Battle
content: Epic Games Inc.’s hit game Fortnite has returned to Apple Inc.’s App Store in the US after more than four years, following a fierce legal battle between the two companies.

title: AI PCs Still Year or Two From Fulfilling Promise, Asus CEO Says
content: The new crop of artificial intelligence-powered PCs will take until 2026 or later to drive the market forward, according to Asustek Computer Inc. co-Chief Executive Officer Samson Hu.

title: Kalshi Pulls Announcement of xAI Tie-Up Hours After Touting Deal
content: Kalshi Inc. withdrew announcements about a collaboration with Elon Musk’s artificial-intelligence firm xAI just hours after a top executive at the prediction markets firm touted the deal.

title: Wolfspeed Put Options Surge Before Report on Bankruptcy Plans
content: Traders ramped up bearish bets Tuesday on Wolfspeed Inc., before the Wall Street Journal reported after regular market hours that the ailing chip component maker is preparing to file for bankruptcy protection within weeks.

title: Match Group Acquires ‘Her’ Dating App for Queer Women
content: Match Group has added ‘Her,’ a dating app for queer women, to its portfolio, Match Chief Executive Officer Spencer Rascoff said in a post on Linkedin.

title: Bloomberg Retracts Story on Kalshi After Firm Rescinds Statement
content: Bloomberg retracted a story published earlier Tuesday saying that Kalshi would partner with artificial-intelligence firm xAI after Kalshi rescinded its statement announcing the product integration deal. The company said details of the release, which stated that the effort would provide users with tailored information, had not been mutually confirmed between the two firms.

title: Thames Tops List of Firms Facing Criminal Probes Over Pollution
content: Thames Water tops a list of water companies under criminal investigation for pollution by the UK government, a move that could complicate efforts to turn around the beleaguered British utility.

title: What Trump’s ‘Golden Dome’ Can Learn From Israeli Air Defenses
content: An exclusive look at what Israel’s upgraded air defense system can (and can’t) do holds lessons for the US as it pushes for a missile shield.

title: WhatsApp Had No Plans to Vie With Facebook, Co-Founder Says
content: WhatsApp co-founder Brian Acton said that his messaging company had no plans to build social networking features to compete with Facebook before he sold the company to Mark Zuckerberg, a claim that bolsters Meta’s defense as it faces federal antitrust allegations.

title: Dell Tech World, Musk Commits to Staying at Tesla | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow, live from Dell Technologies World, discusses developments in AI infrastructure. Plus, Elon Musk says he is committed to running Tesla for the next five years. And Cohere CEO Aidan Gomez says the competitor to OpenAI has doubled its revenue since the start of the year. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Take-Two Dips as Video-Game Maker Preps $1 Billion Stock Sale
content: Take-Two Interactive Software Inc. shares fell as much as 5% in extended trading after the company announced plans to sell $1 billion of new stock to investors.

title: Amazon Gives Refunds for Years-Old Returns
content: Amazon.com Inc. customers are suddenly getting refunds for products they purchased and returned as far back as 2018, along with apologies from the online retailer after it discovered “unresolved” issues.

title: Uber Squeezes More From Aurora Stake With $1.2 Billion Bond Sale
content: Uber Technologies Inc.’s $1.2 billion exchangeable bond deal, linked to its shares in a self-driving truck firm, shows why the unusual financial maneuver can be more attractive than a typical stake sale, according to observers.

title: Xreal and Google Debut Aura AR Glasses to Rival Meta’s Orion Plan
content: Alphabet Inc.’s Google has entered the glasses race by partnering with Xreal Inc. on the first spectacles to run an augmented-reality version of its operating system.

title: Jimmy Fallon Offered $1 Million Air-Taxi Bet by Short Seller
content: Air taxi company Archer Aviation Inc. has been targeted by short sellers before, but the latest attack has an unusual twist: A proposed $1 million “friendly wager” with the TV show host Jimmy Fallon.

title: Alphabet’s Google Bringing AI Mode to Search for US
content: Alphabet Inc.’s Google will offer “AI mode” in search to all US users, part of an effort to bring products to market faster and keep pace with new rivals in the artificial intelligence age.

title: Microsoft-Backed Builder.ai Set for Bankruptcy After Cash Seized
content: Builder.ai, the British artificial intelligence startup backed by Microsoft Corp. and the Qatar Investment Authority, is filing for bankruptcy after the chief executive officer said a major creditor had seized most of its cash.

title: Google Bringing Products to Market Faster: Alphabet CEO
content: Alphabet Inc.’s Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said Google will bring products to market faster to keep pace with new rivals in the artificial intelligence age. “We want to get our best models into your hands,” Pichai said Tuesday at the company’s developer conference in Mountain View, California, “so we are shipping faster than ever.”

title: Musk Commits to Tesla CEO Role and Plans Political Pullback
content: Elon Musk said he’s committed to still leading Tesla Inc. five years from now and expects to pare back his political spending, assuaging some investors’ concerns about the future of his most valuable company.

title: DoorDash Ends AI Voice-Ordering Product for Restaurants
content: DoorDash Inc. ended a pilot of its voice-ordering product for restaurant clients, a year after it poached talent from an artificial intelligence startup to bolster the product.

title: Traders Pare Bets on BOE Cuts, Pound Climbs After UK Inflation
content: Traders pared bets on further interest-rate cuts from the Bank of England, sending the pound to a three-year high versus the dollar, after data showed UK inflation rose more than expected in April.

title: UK Inflation Surge Prompts Traders to Rein In Bets on BOE Cuts
content: UK inflation jumped more than forecast to its highest rate in over a year as households were hit by a raft of price increases, prompting investors to pare bets on rate cuts from the Bank of England.

title: Global Investment, Crypto and AI Top Agenda at Qatar Economic Forum
Japan’s Farm Minister Quits Over Rice Gaffe in Blow to Ishiba
content: Japan’s farm minister quit Wednesday after saying he’s never needed to buy rice, a comment that fueled criticism of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s minority government and its handling of rising food prices ahead of an election.

title: Chinese Authorities Question Metals Bosses in Smuggling Probe
content: Chinese authorities have questioned the heads of some of the country’s leading metals merchants and producers as part of an intensifying effort to crack down on critical-minerals smuggling, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Bank Indonesia Poised to Resume Rate Cuts as Growth Falters
content: Indonesia’s central bank is expected to resume lowering interest rates as the US-China trade truce and the rupiah’s ensuing rebound open up a window of opportunity for policymakers to spur economic growth.

title: G-7 Countries Discuss Tariffs on Low-Value Chinese Products
content: Canadian Finance Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne said Group of Seven countries have started discussing tariffs on oversupplied, low-value Chinese products.

title: US Sets the Stage for Duties on Battery Materials From China
content: The US Commerce Department set the stage for anti-subsidy duties on imports of key battery components from China, after concluding materials had been unfairly subsidized.

title: G-7 Finance Ministers Aim to Avoid Public Spats With US Despite Trade Turmoil
content: Finance ministers who’ve gathered in Canada for a Group of Seven meeting this week face a difficult task — trying to find common ground on trade issues while avoiding public conflict with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.

title: China-US Trade Soars as Exporters Race to Hit Trade Truce Window
content: A temporary trade truce between the world’s two largest economies has sparked a knee-jerk bounce across China’s ports and factory floors.

title: China Ran Record Budget Deficit With Spending Blitz Amid Tariffs
content: China’s fiscal stimulus pushed its four-month budget deficit to a record high, as the government ramped up support for the economy during an escalation in its trade conflict with the US.

title: Japan’s Exports Slow as US Tariffs Bite, Risking Recession
content: Growth in Japan’s exports slowed as the US ramped up its tariff measures, highlighting the risks the country faces after its economy already contracted before the levies began hitting in earnest.

title: South Korean Early May Exports Fall as Shipments to US Slump
content: South Korea’s early trade data showed exports falling again this month especially to the US as negotiations between Seoul and Washington continue over tariffs on shipments from the Asian nation.

title: Fed’s Daly, Hammack Stress Wait-And-See Policy Approach
content: Two Federal Reserve officials underscored the US central bank can be patient and assess incoming data before adjusting policy as the economy navigates heightened uncertainty.

title: Reeves to Meet Bessent as Questions Linger Over UK-US Deal
content: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will hold talks with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent this week, as the two countries continue to finalize the details of an agreement to cut tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump’s administration.

title: South Africa’s Budget Gets Third Reboot With Credibility on Line
content: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana’s third attempt to deliver a budget represents his sternest test yet.

title: Sanctions Risk Pushing Russia Away From Talks, Rubio Says
content: President Donald Trump thinks Russia will likely walk away from Ukraine peace talks if the US threatens more sanctions, according to his top diplomat, supporting the White House’s decision not to pressure Moscow despite its resistance to a ceasefire.

title: Fed’s Musalem Says Tariffs Will Likely Weigh on Growth, Jobs
content: Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said tariffs will likely weigh on the US economy and weaken the labor market.

title: Australia's Rare Feat on Inflation, Jobs May Hold Lessons for Other Economies
content: Through the post-Covid cost-of-living crisis, Australia’s central bank took a gentler approach than global peers to reining in inflation, managing to keep the economy close to full employment throughout — a rare feat that’s sparked debate about its viability as a model to tackle future crises.

title: Brazil Finance Chief Pivots as Lula Lingers in the Limelight
content: Not long ago, Brazil’s finance chief was a rising star in the government of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva. Now, factors beyond Fernando Haddad’s control have put his political ambitions on hold.

title: Influx of Foreign-Born Workers Drove 2024 US Labor Force Growth
content: Foreign-born workers drove US labor force growth for another year in 2024, providing a last boost for the job market before President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown was set in motion.

title: New Zealand Set to Deliver Tight Budget as Economic Outlook Dims
content: New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis will keep a tight rein on spending in this week’s budget as uncertainty about global growth holds back a domestic recovery and restrains government revenue.

title: Romania to Weigh Rate Cuts When Politics and Markets Calm
content: Romania will weigh further interest-rate cuts only after a return to market and political stability, the central bank chief said, as the election of a centrist candidate to the presidency on Sunday spurred preparations to form a new government.

title: Musk Says He’s Pushing Ahead With OpenAI Lawsuit
content: Elon Musk Photographer: Christopher Pike/Bloomberg

title: ECB’s Wunsch Says Economy May Need Some Support From Rates
content: European Central Bank Governing Council member Pierre Wunsch said the euro-zone economy may need interest rates at “mildly supportive” levels to ensure inflation doesn’t fall below target after a series of shocks.

title: Nigeria Holds Key Rate Again Amid ‘Heightened Uncertainty’
content: The Central Bank of Nigeria left interest rates unchanged as it awaits more data to determine the inflation outlook and for the turbulence spawned by US President Donald Trump’s trade war to settle.

title: Canada Inflation Slows on Carbon Tax End, But Core Rises
content: Canadian inflation eased to its slowest pace since September on the elimination of the consumer carbon tax and lower oil prices, but core measures accelerated.

title: White House’s Miran Dismisses Inflation Risk From Tariff Hikes
content: The White House’s chief economist dismissed the idea that tariff increases will have a lasting impact on US inflation, and cited the potential for interest rates to get back down to pre-Covid levels.

title: Singapore Central Bank Chief Says US Dollar Assets Irreplaceable
content: Dollar-based assets have “enduring advantages” and remain virtually irreplaceable in the global financial system despite the US losing its top triple-A credit rating, according to Singapore’s central bank chief.

title: A Spendthrift Saudi Arabia Can’t Finance the World Anymore
content: Hello from Doha. I’m Erik Schatzker, editorial director of Bloomberg New Economy, bringing you a special edition of the newsletter from this year’s Qatar Economic Forum. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Toyota Goes All-Hybrid With Its Best-Selling US Vehicle
content: Toyota Motor Corp. is scrapping the gas-powered version of its best-selling vehicle in the US as the Japanese carmaker doubles down on its push into hybrids.

title: SSE Cuts Spending Plan by £3 Billion Amid Slowing Growth
content: SSE Plc cut its five-year spending plan by £3 billion ($4 billion) as projects slow amid planning delays.

title: Critical Minerals at Higher Risk of Painful Disruption, Says IEA
content: Critical minerals are at increasing risk of “painful disruption” due to their higher concentration in a handful of countries and the spread of export restrictions, according to a report from the International Energy Agency.

title: SocGen CEO Krupa Says He Has Completed ‘Bulk’ of Unit Sales
content: Societe Generale SA is largely done selling units, Chief Executive Officer Slawomir Krupa told shareholders, as the French lender is setting its sights on growth again.

title: Global Investment, Crypto and AI Top Agenda at Qatar Economic Forum
Julius Baer Faces $156 Million Loan Loss Charge
content: Julius Baer Group Ltd. said it’s booking another large loss from property developments it helped finance, just as the Swiss wealth manager is emerging from a crisis triggered by its exposure to Rene Benko’s Signa real estate empire.

title: Rio Tinto Defends Pilbara After Forrest Voices ‘Wasteland’ Fears
content: A Rio Tinto Group executive has defended the future of Australia’s iron ore hub, after mining billionaire Andrew Forrest delivered a downbeat message on its prospects unless it gets more green investment.

title: Chinese Authorities Question Metals Bosses in Smuggling Probe
content: Chinese authorities have questioned the heads of some of the country’s leading metals merchants and producers as part of an intensifying effort to crack down on critical-minerals smuggling, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Global LNG Suppliers Wager That China’s Demand Slump Is Fleeting
content: Global gas giants are betting the current lull in Chinese demand is temporary, and that the country will underpin their multibillion-dollar investments for years to come.

title: China-US Trade Soars as Exporters Race to Hit Trade Truce Window
content: A temporary trade truce between the world’s two largest economies has sparked a knee-jerk bounce across China’s ports and factory floors.

title: FAA Cuts Newark Flights After Air Traffic Control Issues
content: US aviation safety regulators will allow fewer flights at Newark airport after technology outages and a staffing crunch fueled a surge in delays and cancellations in recent weeks.

title: First Alzheimer’s Blood Test Available in US in June
content: The first blood test to help diagnose Alzheimer’s disease will be available from late June in the US following regulatory clearance for its use last week, according to the Japanese company behind the innovation.

title: Chicago Suburb Plans to Seize Pope Leo’s Childhood Home
content: A Chicago-area town plans to seize control of Pope Leo XIV’s childhood home, just days after the current owner put the property up for auction.

title: Former Citi Traders Drop Hong Kong Lawsuit on Cost Concerns
content: Two former Citigroup Inc. traders in Hong Kong abandoned their employment lawsuits after weighing costs and difficulties of taking it to a higher court, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Westpac Plans to Eliminate More Than 1,500 Jobs, AFR Reports
content: Westpac Banking Corp. is planning to cut more than 1,500 jobs in the bank’s biggest redundancy in a decade as it strives to meet ambitious cost reduction targets, the Australian Financial Review reported, citing unidentified people.

title: New Fortress Energy Disqualified From Puerto Rico Power Auction
content: New Fortress Energy has been disqualified from an auction held by the Puerto Rican government to secure temporary power generation, the latest setback for billionaire Wes Edens’ troubled company.

title: Jefferies Fraud Suit Against Ex-Fund Manager Tossed by Judge
content: A Jefferies Financial Group Inc. hedge fund’s lawsuit claiming it was defrauded by a former portfolio manager who invested $100 million of its money in a Ponzi-like scheme was dismissed by a federal judge.

title: Blackstone, CVC Split From Group Set to Invest in NFL Teams
content: Blackstone Inc. and CVC Capital Partners are no longer part of a private equity group that had won preliminary approval to invest in NFL teams, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Nu COO Lahrech Steps Down, Adding to Turnover Atop Fintech
content: Nu Holdings Ltd. said Chief Operating Officer Youssef Lahrech is stepping down after more than five years, adding to a string of management changes in the upper ranks of Latin America’s standout financial technology firm.

title: Roche Needs More US Data on Key Cancer Drug, FDA Advisers Say
content: A group of advisers to the Food and Drug Administration said Roche Holding AG needs to study its blood cancer treatment in more American patients before its use can be expanded.

title: GPIF to Invest $500 Million in a Fund Managed by Thoma Bravo
content: Japan’s Government Pension Investment Fund said it’s investing $500 million in a fund managed by US private equity firm Thoma Bravo, as part of its effort to boost alternative assets.

title: PNC Agrees to Acquire Alternatives Fundraiser Aqueduct Capital
content: PNC Financial Services Group said its bank will acquire Aqueduct Capital Group, a move that expands PNC’s services for alternative asset managers.

title: Kraft Heinz Mulls Deals After Berkshire Hathaway Exits Board
content: Kraft Heinz Co. said it is evaluating potential “strategic transactions” in an effort to boost its stock price, and announced that Berkshire Hathaway Inc. is giving up its seats on the board.

title: What Trump’s ‘Golden Dome’ Can Learn From Israeli Air Defenses
content: An exclusive look at what Israel’s upgraded air defense system can (and can’t) do holds lessons for the US as it pushes for a missile shield.

title: Congo Gambles on Cobalt as US-China Metals Fight Heats Up
content: In the middle of a global trade war, Congo is trying to woo Trump’s White House without risking critical investment from Beijing.

title: Toll Maintains Home Sales Forecast as Luxury Demand Holds Up
content: Luxury builder Toll Brothers Inc. reaffirmed expectations for home sales in its full fiscal year, citing resilience among its affluent buyers.

title: Victoria’s Secret Adopts Poison Pill to Thwart Investor BBRC (3)
content: Victoria’s Secret & Co. announced a shareholder rights plan after an investor began acquiring a substantial amount of stock in the lingerie retailer.

title: NFL Owners Approve 49ers, Chargers’ Sale of Minority Stakes
content: NFL owners approved the sale of a 6.2% stake in the San Francisco 49ers to three investor groups at an $8.5 billion valuation, the highest ever for a sports team.

title: Mary Barra de GM apostó por los autos eléctricos. Ahora, con Trump, debe probar su éxito
content: El fabricante de autos estadounidense se enfrenta a aranceles, a un presidente amante del petróleo y a Elon Musk en la Casa Blanca

title: US Will No Longer Approve Covid Boosters for Healthy Kids, Adults Without New Trials
content: US regulators will no longer approve Covid booster shots for healthy adults and children without new studies, adding a costly requirement for drugmakers, though they will still be available for millions of high-risk Americans.

title: China cuts benchmark lending rates for the first time in 7 months in Beijing's growth push
content: The People's Bank of China trimmed the 1-year loan prime rate to 3.0% from 3.1%, and the 5-year LPR to 3.5% from 3.6%.

title: California bill calls for program to insure multifamily development loans
content: Sen. Dave Cortese has called on the state to use its credit to insure construction and permanent loans for multifamily developments, giving them access to more favorable interest terms

title: Mortgage rates cross back over 7% after U.S. credit downgrade
content: After several weeks of sitting stagnant, mortgage rates surged higher Monday following Moody’s decision to downgrade the U.S. credit rating.

title: Ray Dalio says the risk to U.S. Treasurys is even greater than what Moody’s is saying
content: Bridgewater Associates founder and billionaire Ray Dalio warned Monday that Moody’s downgrade of the U.S. sovereign credit rating understates the threat to U.S.

title: 3 critical credit card debt considerations borrowers should make now
content: With interest rates high and the prospects of relief low, here are three considerations borrowers should make now.

title: Investors shrug off Moody's downgrade as stocks, U.S. borrowing costs stay largely flat
content: Investors largely shrugged off a downgrade of the U.S.' credit rating in Monday trading, as stocks ended the day mostly flat.

title: Mortgage rates cross back over 7% after U.S. credit downgrade
content: The rate on the 30-year fixed mortgage crossed 7%, hitting its highest level since April 11.

title: How climate change could hit your credit score
content: A new report finds a direct link to foreclosures from climate change and suggests as lenders factor that risk into underwriting, it could alter credit scores.

title: Hot on the red carpet: Jewelry you can’t buy
content: From Cartier to Tiffany, jewelry houses are increasingly lending celebrities rare, archival pieces from the vault to wear on the red carpet.

title: What Moody’s downgrade of U.S. credit rating means for your money
content: Moody's decision to downgrade the U.S. credit rating may have far-reaching consequences for your money, experts say.

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

title: By Building Wealth, Investors Power U.S. Economy
content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

content:

content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission is providing extensive guidance and resources to assist filers with upcoming access and account management enhancements to the security of the agency’s Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval (EDGAR)…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Roundtable on Security Status
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B
content: Cybersecurity company Proofpoint announced that it plans to acquire Hornetsecurity, a security provider specialized in Microsoft 365 software tools, in a deal reportedly valued at around $1 billion.

title: Venture Capital’s Second(ary) Chance
content: The lack of a healthy exit market is an existential problem for the venture capital industry, writes guest author Dan Gray, who sees the evolving strategy of secondary markets as one solution.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund
content: Venture investor DFJ Growth announced it has raised $1.2 billion for a fifth flagship fund, its largest to date.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
